messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] interview re: staying connected though the teen years
messages.msgSnippet: ... -=-i only wish it didn t present us as experts , though.... -=- Hey, MUCH better you than a childless guy with a degree in education, or than someone
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>


-=-i only wish it didn't present us as "experts", though.... -=-

Hey, MUCH better you than a childless guy with a degree in education,
or than someone whose teens won't even make eye contact anymore.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>



well, thanks for that! i suppose that's true. much rather be taken seriously due to experience though, without the "expert" title.

Lyla

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] interview re: staying connected though the teen years
messages.msgSnippet: i only wish it didn t present us as experts , though.... ... From: Lyla Wolfenstein To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 11:52 AM
messages.messageBody:
i only wish it didn't present us as "experts", though....

----- Original Message -----
From: Lyla Wolfenstein
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 11:52 AM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] interview re: staying connected though the teen years





per the recent thread here, i thought i would post this link to an interview that just got published. it's with me and my friend emily, and it's about connection and teenagers - not specifically about unschooling, because the audience is far broader than that, but you can certainly see all the "unschooliness" in our responses.

http://www.thetranquilparent.com/detail/staying-connected-through-the-teen-years/

Lyla
